intro: Malacothrix clevelandii, commonly known as Cleveland's malacothrix, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
